page.title: 10GREAT BARDFIELD WATERMILL
page.content: The Great Bardfield watermill is two mills in one. One of the mills is a stone mill which was used for grinding cattle feed and the other is a roller mill which was used for refining flour.The oldest mill is the stone mill which is 4OO years old and the roller mill a 1OO years old. Originally the mill wheel, the mill race and the flood gates were situated on the outside of the stone mill. Then the roller mill was built which enclosed them between the two mills, the purpose being for the mill wheel to drive both mills. When the roller mill was built there was a turbine put underneath the mill which was used to power both mills when the water level dropped.The turbine is believed to have been jammed by rubbish coming down stream when ice carried away the protective grating.
